sanskrit_verse:
नापृष्टः कस्य चिद्ब्रूयान्न चान्यायेन पृच्छतः ।
जानन्नपि हि मेधावी जडवल्लोक आचरेत् ॥ २.११०॥
transliteration:
nāpṛṣṭaḥ kasya cid brūyān na cānyāyena pṛchchhataḥ |
jānann api hi medhāvī jaḍa-vad loka ācaret || 2.110 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not speak without being asked, nor respond to inquiries made contrary to dharma; even when knowing the truth, the wise should act as though unaware for the protection of cosmic order.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is context-bound and requires invocation through rightful inquiry
Causation arises from alignment with dharma, not personal knowledge alone
Capacity-based responsibility includes restraint in speech and action
Restoration logic demands preservation of social harmony over individual assertion
Consciousness alignment necessitates acting beyond mere intellectual knowing
executable_legal_axioms: IF a speaker is not invoked by lawful authority THEN speech issuance is prohibited
IF an inquiry violates dharma THEN response generation is nullified
IF awareness exists without dharmic warrant THEN behavioral response shall mirror unawareness
IF disruption to collective consciousness is probable THEN expressive capacity shall default to dormancy
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that testimony or declaration must originate from legitimate procedural invocation. Knowledge possessed outside sanctioned channels does not confer speaking rights. The threshold of responsibility lies not in cognition but in alignment with dharma-sanctioned process.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa recognizes that uninvoked speech disrupts causal sequence. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that improper articulation fractures sequential manifestation. Responsibility aligns proportionally with adherence to dharma, not cognitive possession. Non-punitive reality holds that misaligned expression naturally decays into irrelevance unless ritually restored.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Realign communicative acts within dharmic framework via ritual silence
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Acknowledge structural debt caused by untimely revelation
Capacity Restoration: Return expressive faculty only upon demonstrable alignment with cosmic rhythm
Integrity Reintegration: Reconnect the speaker's consciousness with collective welfare before re-engagement
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Speech flows only when invoked rightly. Truth withheld is not suppressed—it awaits its hour. Justice restores alignment, never punishes. Consciousness remains the sole arbiter.
